title: (x) New York Public Library sign engraving - hand inscripted {Stephen}
content:
Does anybody know what font is or closely resembles  
the New York Public Library Main branch sign?

(see attached detail)

The R is beautiful (and unprecedented?)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [nypl\_lettering.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/typophile.com/files/nypl_lettering.jpg) | 324.28 KB |

 [‹ (x) Million Dollar 1950s script - Susie Q/Honey Script {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38573 "Go to previous forum topic") [Magazine cover fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38421 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joe M.

comments.content: This was hand inscripted so no typeface will match. You might like [Serlio](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/serlio_lt_std_ot/), [Classic Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/sackers_light_classic_roman/), [Goldenbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mark_simonson/goldenbook_regular/), [Grand Central](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/grand_central_light/), or LetterPerfect’s [Baroque Set](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205084202/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/letterperfect/the_baroque_set/).

Many thanks for the leads—  
Serlio is very close; as well as  
LP’s Baroque.
